meanings.definition: To confine or restrict within a space
meanings.sent1: The cat was interning itself in the small box.
meanings.sent2: She was interning her toys in the toy chest.
meanings.sent3: The sandwich was interning the pickle slices between the bread.
meanings.sent4: The fog was interning the city in a mysterious embrace.
meanings.sent5: The spider was interning the fly in its web.

meanings.definition: To work as an intern in a company or organization
meanings.sent1: He was interning at the local bakery to learn about baking.
meanings.sent2: She is interning at the hospital to gain experience in healthcare.
meanings.sent3: The student was interning at the zoo, feeding the animals.
meanings.sent4: The aspiring chef was interning at a famous restaurant to improve his skills.
meanings.sent5: They are interning at a tech company to learn about software development.

meanings.definition: The act of temporarily imprisoning someone
meanings.sent1: The internment of the suspect was necessary for the investigation.
meanings.sent2: The internment of the criminal was a precautionary measure.
meanings.sent3: The internment of the cat in the carrier was for a trip to the vet.
meanings.sent4: The internment of the treasure in the chest was to keep it safe.
meanings.sent5: The internment of the books in the library shelves was organized.
